intro: Pilosella spathophyllopsis, commonly known as the silverleaf pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is notable for its dense, white to silver-gray hairs covering its stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, silvery appearance. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Pilosella spathophyllopsis is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
